sections.name: Ability Scores
sections.content: Every character has six ability scores that represent their basic attributes: Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma. These scores typically range from 8 to 18 for starting characters. Each ability score has a modifier ranging from -1 to +4 for most starting characters.

subsections.name: Strength
subsections.content: Strength measures physical power and affects melee attack rolls, damage rolls with melee weapons, athletics checks, and carrying capacity.

subsections.name: Dexterity
subsections.content: Dexterity measures agility and affects armor class, reflex saves, ranged attack rolls, and acrobatics checks.

subsections.name: Constitution
subsections.content: Constitution measures endurance and affects hit points, fortitude saves, and recovery from certain conditions.

subsections.name: Intelligence
subsections.content: Intelligence measures reasoning and memory, affecting knowledge-based skills, crafting, and the number of trained skills for some classes.

subsections.name: Wisdom
subsections.content: Wisdom measures perception and insight, affecting perception checks, survival checks, and will saves.

subsections.name: Charisma
subsections.content: Charisma measures force of personality, affecting diplomacy, intimidation, performance, and certain magical abilities.

sections.name: Proficiency
sections.content: In Pathfinder 2e, your proficiency in various abilities, skills, and equipment determines your aptitude. Proficiency comes in five ranks: untrained, trained, expert, master, and legendary.

subsections.name: Proficiency Bonus
subsections.content: Your proficiency bonus is equal to your level plus a modifier based on your rank: untrained (0), trained (2), expert (4), master (6), or legendary (8).

sections.name: Actions
sections.content: In Pathfinder 2e, activities during encounters are measured in actions. On your turn, you get 3 actions and 1 reaction to use as you see fit.

subsections.name: Single Actions
subsections.content: Most common activities, such as making an attack, moving, raising a shield, or drawing a weapon, cost 1 action.

subsections.name: Two-Action Activities
subsections.content: More complex activities, such as casting many spells or administering first aid, cost 2 actions.

subsections.name: Three-Action Activities
subsections.content: Particularly powerful or complex activities, such as casting higher-level spells or using certain special abilities, cost 3 actions.

subsections.name: Reactions
subsections.content: Reactions are special actions that can be taken even when it's not your turn, in response to specific triggers. You get 1 reaction per round.

sections.name: Combat
sections.content: Combat in Pathfinder 2e takes place in encounters, with participants acting in initiative order. Each round, participants take turns using their actions and reactions.

subsections.name: Initiative
subsections.content: At the start of an encounter, all participants roll for initiative, usually using Perception. The order of initiative determines the order of turns during the encounter.

subsections.name: Attacks
subsections.content: Attacks in Pathfinder 2e use a multiple attack penalty. Your first attack on your turn has no penalty, your second attack has a -5 penalty, and your third attack has a -10 penalty.

subsections.name: Critical Success
subsections.content: If you roll a natural 20 on an attack roll, or if your result exceeds the target's AC by 10 or more, you score a critical success, dealing double damage.
